vector or matrix of same format than xp and yp, elementwise evaluation of s on these points.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Given three vectors (x,y,C) defining a bicubic spline or sub-spline function (see splin2d) this function evaluates s (and ds/dx, ds/dy, d2s/dxx, d2s/dxy, d2s/dyy if needed) at (xp(i),yp(i)) :
The out_mode parameter defines the evaluation rule for extrapolation, i.e. for (xp(i),yp(i)) not in [x(1),x(nx)]x[y(1),y(ny)]:

listitem.para: an extrapolation by zero is done
the extrapolation is defined as follows :
listitem.programlisting: s(x,y) = s(proj(x,y)) where proj(x,y) is nearest point of [x(1),x(nx)]x[y(1),y(ny)] from (x,y)

listitem.para: the extrapolation is done by using the nearest bicubic-patch from (x,y).
